alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 10:20PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL COLFAX COUNTY THROUGH 1045 PM MDT... At 1020 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Maxwell, or 16 miles northeast of Springer, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Maxwell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 427 and 436. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 363 and 366. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM MDT for northeastern New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
